definition: to tremble/to shiver/uncontrolled shaking of the body

sentences.english: In deep night, when on the narrow bridge the traveler trembles.
sentences.chinese: 每當深夜，浪遊者在山間小路哆嗦戰慄。

sentences.english: The girl frightened trembles , said that got rid the serial number.
sentences.chinese: 女孩嚇得哆哆嗦嗦，說出了手機號。

sentences.english: It was so cold that we were all shivering.
sentences.chinese: 天氣冷極了，我們全部打着哆嗦。

sentences.english: Please give his the coat, you see that he's shivering with cold.
sentences.chinese: 請把這件大衣給他，你看他冷得直哆嗦。

sentences.english: As always, the gin made him shudder and even retch slightly.
sentences.chinese: 像往常一樣，他感到一陣哆嗦，甚至有些噁心。

sentences.english: He was as pale as death and trembling in every limb.
sentences.chinese: 他面色慘白，手足都在哆嗦。

sentences.english: He frightens keep cringing , saw ghost similar for the good elephant.
sentences.chinese: 他嚇得直哆嗦，就好象看到了鬼一樣。

sentences.english: A sudden gust of cold wind made me shiver.
sentences.chinese: 一股突然刮來的冷風吹得我打哆嗦。

sentences.english: So am I, for that matter.
sentences.chinese: 他冷得直打哆嗦，其實我也是。

sentences.english: Shivering in their wet clothes, the teenagers looked on while three men dived repeatedly into the water to locate the dish.
sentences.chinese: 那幾個孩子衣服還溼着，此時在一旁哆哆嗦嗦地看着。

sentences.english: I took out my walled and nervously fumbled for the pictures of my family.
sentences.chinese: 說着，我摸出皮夾，哆哆嗦嗦地掏出了家人的照片。

sentences.english: He remembered her trembling uncertainty in his arms, her shocked cries of pleasure.
sentences.chinese: 他想起了她瑟縮在他的懷裏，她快樂叫着哆嗦着。

sentences.english: Shaking with lee mother angry blame dong-qing li to find a tartar.
sentences.chinese: 李母氣的直哆嗦，埋怨李冬青找回來個潑婦。

sentences.english: Harry groaned and sank, shaking, on to his bed , rubbing his scar.
sentences.chinese: 哈利呻吟一聲，哆嗦着坐到牀上，揉着傷疤。

sentences.english: Melly's hand shook, almost upsetting her cup of coffee.
sentences.chinese: 梅利的手哆嗦着，幾乎弄翻了她的咖啡杯。

definition: to tremble/to shake out/to reveal/to make it in the world
variant of 冷戰|冷战[leng3 zhan5]
to scare/to intimidate/to threaten/(interjection showing disapproval) tut-tut/(interjection showing astonishment)
to tremble/to shiver/to shake/to vibrate/Taiwan pr. [zhan4]
calf (back of the leg below the knee)
to curl up shivering (from cold)/timid and trembling (in fear)/to shrink/to cower
to sift chaff/(fig.) to shake all over
